item.title: Dumped mattress/large upholstered cushion, 1st September
item.description:
Dumped mattress/large upholstered cushion on corner of Norway Gate and Redriff Road. This has previously been reported on 28/8 and is now showing as ‘fixed’ but it is still there as of 1/9. Please arrange removal. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norway Gate, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chair, recycle bin, gas canister, glass bottle. Plastic bottles under tree., 1st September
item.description:
This area seems to be neglected. As people walk through the alleyway they drop litter. After the tree were cut down there are lots of weeds on the road. Glass bottle, gas canister. Plastic bottles. Dumped chair, old recycle bin. Please clear this up. I often pick up litter but these are dirty. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Crescent, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gutter, 1st September
item.description:
134 evering road gutter is blocked with leaves from over sized tree located in 134 evering road . I have reported this before without response previously. The blocked gutter that is in 134 evering road is also causing damage to my property

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Evering Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised flags on every lamp post, 1st September
item.description:
A lot of flags have appeared along Bellegrove Road / Welling High Street These flags are not authorised by anyone. It is not right to allow a small vocal minority to break the rules. The law of the land must stand firm against the angry mob. Normalisation of the divisive tactics of idealogical extremists must not be tolerated by a Council who serves people of all persuasions. Not only that, they are all flying at half mast and a lot of them are upside down. No nationally significant figure has died recently and we are not on a sea-going vessel in distress. It's embarrassing. Take them down please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70a, Bellegrove Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped stuff not dealt with, 1st September
item.description:
I reported this earlier today. The crew came and took one household item that was leaning against the bin. I asked for the litter and bin to be removed. I’m not sure where the bin has come from but it is a magnet for litter and fly- tipping. Thank u.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hayling Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
